abstract: Thousands of low-priority immigrants are being deported from United States each week, despite Pres Obama's assurance that those who do not pose threat to national security or public safety should not worry; some immigrant communities are in state of panic, and have begun to protest.
lead_paragraph: After Thursday’s Supreme Court decision, President Obama said immigrants who would have been protected would still be safe, but thousands of deportation operations per week are sweeping up immigrants with minor or no offenses.

headline.main: Low-Priority Immigrants Still Swept Up in Net of Deportation
headline.print_headline: Low-Priority Immigrants, Still Swept Up in U.S. Deportation Net

snippet: After Thursday’s Supreme Court decision, President Obama said immigrants who would have been protected would still be safe, but thousands of deportation operations per week are sweeping up immigrants with minor or no offenses.
